Package com.eventApp.DAO

Class UserDAO

java.lang.Object
com.eventApp.DAO.UserDAO
public class UserDAO extends Object
Data Access Object for user-related database operations. Handles user authentication, registration, validation, and club management operations. Serves as the central DAO for user lifecycle management in the application.

  • Constructor Details

    • UserDAO

      public UserDAO()

  • Method Details

    • checkDuplicateEmail

      public static void checkDuplicateEmail(String newEmail) throws ValidationException, SQLException, ClassNotFoundException
      Validates that an email address is not already registered in the system. Part of the registration validation process to ensure unique email addresses.
      Parameters:
      newEmail - the email address to validate for uniqueness
      Throws:
      ValidationException - if the email already exists in the database
      SQLException - if database operation fails
      ClassNotFoundException - if database driver is not found

    • checkDuplicateEnrollment

      public static void checkDuplicateEnrollment(String enrollment) throws ValidationException, SQLException, ClassNotFoundException
      Validates that an enrollment number (user ID) is not already registered. Ensures unique enrollment numbers across all users in the system.
      Parameters:
      enrollment - the enrollment number to validate for uniqueness
      Throws:
      ValidationException - if the enrollment number already exists
      SQLException - if database operation fails
      ClassNotFoundException - if database driver is not found

    • registrationUser

      public void registrationUser(User user) throws DatabaseExceptionHandler, SQLException, ClassNotFoundException
      Registers a new user in the users table with basic information. This is the first step in user registration before role-specific data insertion.
      Parameters:
      user - the User object containing registration information
      Throws:
      DatabaseExceptionHandler - if user registration fails
      SQLException - if database operation fails
      ClassNotFoundException - if database driver is not found

    • checkLoginDetails

      public boolean checkLoginDetails(String emailInput, String passwordInput)
      Validates user login credentials by checking email and password. Uses secure password comparison to verify authentication.
      Parameters:
      emailInput - the email address provided for login
      passwordInput - the password provided for login
      Returns:
      true if credentials are valid, false otherwise

    • resetPass

      public void resetPass(String emailInput, String newPassword) throws SQLException, ClassNotFoundException, DatabaseExceptionHandler
      Updates a user's password in the database. Used for password reset functionality after email verification.
      Parameters:
      emailInput - the email address of the user
      newPassword - the new password to set
      Throws:
      SQLException - if database operation fails
      ClassNotFoundException - if database driver is not found
      DatabaseExceptionHandler - if user is not found or update fails

    • registrationClub

      public void registrationClub(Club club) throws SQLException, ClassNotFoundException, DatabaseExceptionHandler
      Registers a new club in the system. Creates the club with pending status for admin approval.
      Parameters:
      club - the Club object containing club information
      Throws:
      SQLException - if database operation fails
      ClassNotFoundException - if database driver is not found
      DatabaseExceptionHandler - if club registration fails

    • getUserByemail

      public User getUserByemail(String emailInput)
      Retrieves a complete User object by email address. Used during login process to get user information after authentication.
      Parameters:
      emailInput - the email address to search for
      Returns:
      User object with complete information, or null if not found

    • getUserNameBy

      public String getUserNameBy(String userId)
      Retrieves the display name for a given user ID. Used for showing user names in UI components without exposing full user details.
      Parameters:
      userId - the unique identifier of the user
      Returns:
      String containing the user's name, or null if not found
